title.narrative: ALTERNATIVE CHILD CARE

description.narrative: By 2022, children without parental care and at risk of institutionalization have access to family support and /or family substitute care based on standards and guidelines, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable children in Ukraine benefit from more-child-friendly and family-oriented social welfare and justice systems.

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/882 CHILD-FRIENDLY AND FAMILY-ORIENTED SOCIAL WELFARE AND JUSTICE SYSTEMS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, children without parental care and at risk of institutionalization have access to family support and /or family substitutecare based on standards and guidelines

description.narrative: Ukraine remains one of the countries in Europe with high number of children in institutional care (1.2% of the child population in institutions in 2020). ; UNICEF continues its advocacy for a comprehensive child welfare,DIreform and further strengthening of the national “gatekeeping” system at all levels. Meanwhile, UNICEF and partners continue to work on strengthening the existing alternative care system, as well as introducing new family-type alternative care forms, capacity development of ;socialworkforce, and expanding policy dialogue at national and sub-national levels aiming to further influence the national policies in the area of alternative childcare.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country (23-03-L3-01), Text
